definition: to support/frame/rack/framework/classifier for planes, large vehicles, radios etc

sentences.english: A HUGE cloud of dust rose and an overpass disappeared.
sentences.chinese: 一片巨大的灰塵騰空而起，一座高架橋瞬間消失了。

sentences.english: There was a railroad viaduct in Pilsen that was rumored to be haunted.
sentences.chinese: 皮爾森有一座鐵路高架橋，傳說常常鬧鬼。

sentences.english: The three overpasses and the Olympic Central District will be lit up by the newly installed lights.
sentences.chinese: 這三座高架橋和奧運中心區將被新安裝的景觀燈照亮。

sentences.english: Viaduct accounts for 86 percent of the Pearl Line.
sentences.chinese: 摘要明珠線全長86%是高架橋。

sentences.english: The viaduct becomes a large-scale connecting machine and a linear building.
sentences.chinese: 高架橋是一個大型的連接機器和線性建築。

sentences.english: The Renmin Road Viaduct in Guangzhou is the first viaduct in China.
sentences.chinese: 廣州人民路高架橋是國內第一座高架橋。

sentences.english: The Renmin Road Viaduct in Guangzhou is the first viaduct in China.
sentences.chinese: 廣州人民路高架橋是國內第一座高架橋。

definition: Tianqiao district of Jinan city 濟南市|济南市[Ji3 nan2 shi4], Shandong/Tianqiao district in Beijing, formerly a center of folk culture
bay bridge (elevated bridge across stretch of water)
Da Qiao, one of the Two Qiaos, according to Romance of the Three Kingdoms 三國演義|三国演义[San1 guo2 Yan3 yi4], the two great beauties of ancient China
to lay (railroad tracks, carpet, pipeline)/to install (wiring, cable)/to construct (road, concrete slab)
building (a relatively large, multi-storey one)/CL:幢[zhuang4],座[zuo4]
a pier/a landing-stage/a loading trestle for goods or passengers/a platform
